attributes.action: Remove Gordon Brown from office and government due to the pension’s fiasco.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After deciding to scrap the dividend tax credit in 1997, Gordon Brown's department has been robbing all of us to the tune of £5bn a year. When compounded, it could add up to about £100bn. This will not only cause me to loose a considerable amount of money in my pension fund, but most other people as well. It could cost the younger generation, who currently pay into a pension fund, up to £50,000.00 throughout their working life.

He knew exactly what he was doing at the time but never admitted it. And he still won’t.

If he was in a top company management position he would have been sacked before now for major misjudgement of funds. Time to go Mr Brown.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
